message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DB. 

This paper is about utilizing knowledge bases in ad-hoc retrieval, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR) in computer science. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques such as word-based and entity-based representations, which fall under cs.CL. The use of an attention-based ranking model and back-propagation suggests the involvement of machine learning (ML) techniques, which can be categorized under cs.AI and cs.LG. Finally, the paper mentions handling uncertainties from automatically constructed entity representations, which could involve database (DB) techniques.
